title: Husham Mohammed
text:
Husham Mohammed Fayadh Al-Dulaimi (, simply known as Husham Mohammed, born 10 May 1974 in <a href="Ramadi">Ramadi</a>, <a href="Iraq">Iraq</a>) is a former <a href="Iraq">Iraq</a>i <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> striker who last played for <a href="Al-Karkh%20SC">Al-Karkh</a> in <a href="Iraq">Iraq</a>.
He made his debut for Iraq in 1998. After never been given an opportunity in an Iraqi jersey by former coaches <a href="Najih%20Humoud">Najih Humoud</a> and <a href="Milan%20Zivadinovic">Milan Zivadinovic</a>, Husham was thrown a lifeline by <a href="Adnan%20Hamad">Adnan Hamad</a> who gave him a starting place against Macao ahead of regular striker Qahtan Chathir alongside Sabah Jeayer. He took his chance scoring 5 goals in the game helping Iraq to an 8-0 trashing over their group rivals.
Coaching career.
Zakho FC.
Mohammed began his coaching career as an assistant to the Libyan <a href="Abdul-Hafeedh%20Arbeesh">Abdul-Hafeedh Arbeesh</a> in <a href="Zakho%20FC">Zakho FC</a> club, Arbeesh got sacked after 2 months. Mohammed stayed in the club as an assistant to the new coach Ali Hadi.
